org.jointheleague.graphical.robot

Interface RobotInterface

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    Robot

    • Method Detail

      • changeRobot

        void changeRobot(java.awt.image.BufferedImage im)
        Changes the image of the Robot
        Parameters:
        im - a BufferedImage containing the robot image. It does not need to be to scale since it will be scaled to the appropriate size.

      • changeRobot

        void changeRobot(java.lang.String urlName)
        Changes the image of the Robot
        Parameters:
        urlName - The URL of the image that specifies the Robot's image.

      • getPenWidth

        int getPenWidth()

      • setPenWidth

        void setPenWidth(int size)
        Sets the pen size.
        Parameters:
        size - the new pen size given as an integer between 1 and 10.

      • getPenColor

        java.awt.Color getPenColor()

      • setPenColor

        void setPenColor(java.awt.Color color)
        Sets the pen color
        Parameters:
        color - the new pen color

      • setPenColor

        void setPenColor(int r,
                 int g,
                 int b)
        Sets the pen color given the red, green and blue components of the new color. The components are specified as an integer between 0 and 255.
        Parameters:
        r - the red component of the new color
        g - the green component of the new color
        b - the blue component of the new color

      • setRandomPenColor

        void setRandomPenColor()
        Sets the pen color to a random color.

      • clearLines

        void clearLines()
        Removes all lines drawn by this Robot.

      • miniaturize

        void miniaturize()
        Makes the image of the Robot small

      • expand

        void expand()
        Makes the image of the Robot big

      • sparkle

        void sparkle()
        Makes the Robot sparkle.

      • unSparkle

        void unSparkle()
        Removes sparkles

      • hide

        void hide()
        Make the Robot invisible. The Robot is visible initially.

      • show

        void show()
        Makes the Robot visible

      • move

        void move(int distance)
        Makes the robot move a given distance. A negative distance makes the robot move backwards.
        Parameters:
        distance - the distance to move in units of points

      • microMove

        void microMove(int sgn)
        throws java.lang.InterruptedException
        Makes the Robot move one step. If the sgn is negative, the Robot moves one step backwards. The step size depends on the Robot's speed. This method is intended to be used by a KeyboardAdapter.
        Parameters:
        sgn - if positive the Robot moves forward, if negative the Robot moves backwards.
        Throws:
        java.lang.InterruptedException - if interrupted before making the turn (which is very unlikely to happen).
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if sgn is 0.

      • turn

        void turn(int degrees)
        Makes the Robot turn in place a given number of degrees. If the argument is positive, the Robot turn clockwise, if negative the Robot turns counter-clockwise.
        Parameters:
        degrees - The number of degrees to turn.

      • microTurn

        void microTurn(int sgn)
        throws java.lang.InterruptedException
        Makes the Robot turn in place a small angle. If the argument is positive, the Robot turn clockwise, if negative the Robot turns counter-clockwise. The angle turn is dependent on the Robot's speed.
        Parameters:
        sgn - The sign of the direction to turn.
        Throws:
        java.lang.InterruptedException - if interrupted before making the turn (which is very unlikely to happen).
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the sgn is 0.

      • sleep

        void sleep(int millis)
        Waits a given number of milliseconds.
        Parameters:
        millis - the number of milliseconds to wait

      • moveTo

        void moveTo(int x,
            int y)
        Move the Robot to a given position. The Robot does not draw any line.
        Parameters:
        x - the x-coordinate of the new position
        y - the y-coordinate of the new position

      • penUp

        void penUp()
        Lifts the pen, i.e., the Robot stops drawing lines.

      • penDown

        void penDown()
        Set the pen down, i.e., the Robot traces its movements with lines.

      • setSpeed

        void setSpeed(int speed)
        Sets the speed of the Robot.
        Parameters:
        speed - the speed specified as a number between 1 and 100.

      • addKeyboardAdapter

        void addKeyboardAdapter(KeyboardAdapter adapter)
        Adds a KeyboardAdapter to the robot. It is possible to add more than one KeyboardAdapter, each controlling a different Robot. If two KeyboardAdapters controlling the same Robot are added, the last one added replaces the first.
        Parameters:
        adapter - the KeyboardAdapter
        See Also:
        KeyboardAdapter
